snippet: Gov. Mark Dayton says he will sign a bill making Minnesota the 12th state to permit same-sex marriage and the first in the Midwest to do it without a court forcing it to.
abstract: Minnesota's Democrat-controlled State Senate votes 37 to 30 to allow same-sex marriages, making it nation's 12th state to do so and first in Midwest to take such step outside of court ruling; measure was previously approved by State House and Gov Mark Dayton says he will sign bill.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Mark Dayton says he will sign a bill making Minnesota the 12th state to permit same-sex marriage and the first in the Midwest to do it without a court forcing it to.

headline.seo: Minnesota Senate Clears Way for Same-Sex Marriage
headline.main: Minnesota Senate Clears Way for Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Minnesota Senate Clears Way for Same-Sex Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
